title: Methuen woman searching for her wedding dress after dry cleaner mix-up
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Kathleen Shea Dunleavy from Methuen is searching for her wedding dress after a 15-year mix-up by a closed dry cleaner.
Dunleavy mistakenly received another bride's dress and now seeks her own gown featuring blue initials "KS" and unique embellishments.
She is using social media to appeal for help, hoping someone knows about the 2010 gown mix-up at Deluxe Cleaners in Methuen.

title: At Chevalier Theatre, Mavis Staples lives up to her legacy of joy and protest
author: Terence Cawley
bullets: Mavis Staples performed a 12-song set at Medford's Chevalier Theatre, showcasing her blend of gospel-soul and modern Americana.
At 86, Staples energized the crowd with vintage songs, powerful vocals, and messages of joy and social protest.
Staples covered songs by Kevin Morby and others, balancing uplifting moments with reminders of current social issues.

title: Here’s how the Red Sox plan on handling MLB’s new ABS challenging system
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Red Sox's Wilson Contreras wins first ABS challenge during spring training, indicating quick adjustment to MLB's new system.
Manager Alex Cora advises Red Sox players to embrace the new ABS challenge system, emphasizing strategic usage for success.
Players in the Red Sox lineup with Triple-A experience, like Nate Eaton, have familiarity with the ABS system's 75% success rate.

title: Red Sox ace Garrett Crochet weighs in on Lucas Giolito’s ongoing free agency
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Lucas Giolito opted out of a $19 million deal with the Red Sox after a strong 2025 season.
Garrett Crochet, Red Sox ace, expressed surprise over Giolito's continued free agency status despite his 3.41 ERA in 2025.
Boston added Sonny Gray and Ranger Suarez, making Giolito's return to the Red Sox unlikely.

title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots eye Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr., who might face trade due to cap issues and team direction.
Bears WR DJ Moore, known for deep-threat capability, may be a Patriots target despite a $24.5 million cap hit.
Jaguars OL Walker Little presents a versatile trade option, potentially filling guard or tackle roles for Patriots.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a five-on-five scrimmage during Celtics practice but doesn't have a set return date.
Celtics remain cautious, not announcing Tatum's return despite speculation, focusing on his complete recovery from Achilles injury.
Tatum's return speculated for March, with Celtics home games lined up and promotional hints from a new documentary series.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko earned praise for their call during Team USA's gold medal win in women's hockey.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir used silence effectively during Alysa Liu's gold-winning figure skating routine.
NBC Sports' commentators embraced restraint in broadcasting key Olympic moments, potentially enhancing viewer experience.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston extends the free MBTA bus pilot program for routes 23, 28, and 29 through June 2026.
Mayor Michelle Wu's initiative began in March 2022 using $8 million in federal pandemic relief funds.
Discussions on the program's long-term future continue, with uncertainty on funding beyond June.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snow totals, with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches and Greenfield accumulating 5 inches.
Essex County saw snowfall accumulations around 4 to 5 inches, with Haverhill reporting up to 5 inches.
The National Weather Service anticipates a 'high impact' snowstorm with blizzard conditions on Sunday into Monday.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon in memory of the 2013 bombing victims.
LaRosa draws inspiration from her coworker, Annie, who has completed the marathon 24 times and has coached her.
The April 20, 2026 race marks a personal achievement for LaRosa, honoring victims and overcoming personal challenges.
